subject: Re: [junit] Re: performance testing
msgSnippet: ...  ... What if you just extended TestCase and made all your tests extend that new implementation? Would that work? Isn t that how JUnitPerf works? --
messageBody:
Chad Woolley wrote:

> This is a situation where Aspect-Oriented Programming might be useful
> after all.
>
<snip />

> AOP could be well suited for this type of task, because otherwise you
> would have to duplicate this monitoring code (or at least remember to
> duplicate a call to it) in each test method.

What if you just extended TestCase and made all your tests extend that
new implementation? Would that work? Isn't that how JUnitPerf works?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
